HediffDef.label: incubating fleshmass tumor
HediffDef.description: All bodily functions are redirected to sustain the growth of the fleshmass tumor, a fatal process, as the cyst has become inextricably intertwined with the organ structure. However, the cyst is dependent on the host's survival.

HediffDef.label: fleshmass cyst assimilates
HediffDef.description: TThe fleshmass cyst, implanted within the host's body, is undergoing assimilation, resulting in considerable pain. The cyst is dependent on the host's survival.

HediffDef.label: fleshmass liver
HediffDef.description: A cancerous mass of semi-sentient flesh. The harsh acid it produces is painful, but strong enough to prevent most food poisoning.\n\nThe organ has its own neural structures and may become dangerous if removed.

li.letterText: Attempting to remove {PAWN_nameDef}'s fleshmass liver has caused the twisting mass of flesh to attack. The fleshmass has detached from {PAWN_nameDef} and transformed into a fleshbeast!
